page.title: 04Transport in Braydon
page.content: The main mode of transport is by car in this area. The roads, although narrow are well maintained. A public transport system would not be economical because of the sparse population in the area. There are bus services to transport school children and college students. Age Concern- a group with a special interest in the elderly - arranges a monthly concessionary bus service. This is funded by the Parish Council. There is some concern at the heavy lorry transport on the Ashton Keynes to Wootton Bassett road, passing through Braydon. The lorries transport gravel from Ashton Keynes to the new expansion area of West Swindon and Woodshaw. For those who prefer to cycle there is a cycleway passing Drill Farm, The Firs and Park View Farm.
